review: Currently working through the Python Fundamentals Track (20+ modular course). It's more expensive than Udemy, but it's obvious why. Production is very good. The USP for me was the interactive python shell. You're introduced to a concept via a video, then apply it using real data. You can learn at your own speed and complete a daily challenge on what module you're currently studying. Hugo is good at keeping you motivated, funny guy.

review: I think that this would be a great way of teaching python, but unless you are willing to pay money, you have to wait 4 and a half hours in between lessons. I personally do not like this and so I am rating this 2 stars.

review: DataCamp is helping me learn the fundamentals in Python, and with a good pace I believe I will one day graduate from a beginner to a pro. I love the simplicity of the lessons and tests, my progress is tracked... I will suggest DataCamp for everyone, both those who want to learn python on desktop (the desktop experience is amazing) and on mobile.
